definitions.definition: a person who makes money by starting or running businesses, especially when this involves taking financial risks

examples.text: A creative entrepreneur, he was continually dreaming up new projects.
a recent MBA graduate and **budding entrepreneur**
a serial entrepreneur who had founded four companies
The risks of starting your own business can be very great, and most budding entrepreneurs find that they have never worked so hard in their lives.

wordOrigin: early 19th cent. (denoting the director of a musical institution): from French, from entreprendre ‘undertake’, based on Latin prendere, prehendere ‘to take’.
